CONJUGATES: fathers (noun plural) | fathers (verb third person singular present) | fathering (verb present participle) | fathered (verb past tense, past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English fæder, from Proto-Germanic *fadēr, from Proto-Indo-European *ph₂tḗr.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A man in relation to his child or children; a male parent.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My father taught me how to ride a bicycle.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我父亲教我如何骑自行车。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An originator or founder of something; someone who creates or develops something new.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某事物的创始人、发明者或先驱。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He is considered the father of modern physics.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他被认为是现代物理学之父。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A title for a priest or other cleric, especially in the Roman Catholic Church.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 神父或其他神职人员的称谓，尤指罗马天主教会。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Father Michael delivered a moving sermon.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 迈克尔神父做了一场感人的布道。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To be the male parent of (a child); to beget. Also, to originate or create something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 成为（孩子）的父亲；生下。也指创立或创造某物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He controversially fathered a child out of wedlock. | The idea was fathered by a small team of engineers.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他未经婚姻生育了一个孩子，这引起了争议。| 这个想法是由一小群工程师提出的。
